TopicTitle: The K Prize - 100% reusable spaceplane to orbit and back

Articles.Content: Um, well......  I found all the parts.

Well, I made a new smaller one,![GnDbJF3.png](http://i.imgur.com/GnDbJF3.png)

and it gets into orbit,![DyGDCx3.png](http://i.imgur.com/DyGDCx3.png)

but it seems that I'm bad at landing things in such a manner that they retain the native organization of their collective parts.  I will attempt another landing from the save I have in orbit with a stricter definition of the term "landed".

[https://postimg.org/gallery/2i4qt6hnc/9beabcf9/](https://postimg.org/gallery/2i4qt6hnc/9beabcf9/)

Quick entry for the lightest category. 5.200t Kolibri I. Still room for improvement though but good enough for now.

Well it seems me and [@tseitsei89](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/162979-tseitsei89/) have come to about the same design.  I have mine at a dry mass of 2.99t due to my choice of control surfaces but I think this is literally the lowest limit of the <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> spaceplane.

![H7qE790.png](http://i.imgur.com/H7qE790.png)

Incidentally, it's quite possible to cook the wings off this thing on the way to orbit, that rapier gets it up to like 7 Gs of acceleration.

Pls show us ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/B6uanufZ9Ps?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

There we go! That drogue chute is probably unnecessary but with that I can land this thing without damages almost every time instead of ~10% of the time so it is there for now ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

4.277 tons in the <abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr> (so without the kerbal).

Some improvements compared to Kolibri I :

1. BigS wingstrakes too heavy and DRAGGY. Changed them to normal wing strakes.

2. Used a command chair inside a fairing instead of inside a service bay- Much less draggy.

3. Realised that I don't really need the small reaction wheel and battery for anything so got rid of those.

4.Used smallest/lightest control surfaces.

5. Reduced drag meant that I could take out half of the oxidizer and some of the liquid fuel from the FL-400 tank and still have plenty to get to orbit.

Improvement ideas:

1. Ditch the drogue and learn to pilot properly ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

2. Better ascent profile? Didn't play with that too much...

3. Is different intake better?

4. Is FL-400 the best tank choice or possibly a combination of 2 smaller tanks?

But yeah. Good enough for now.

Not yet no. That was just a quick attempt to see how I should fly (and land :P) a thing like that. Next I'll see how light I can actually get... So how much wing and fuel can I get rid off...

[http://imgur.com/a/B5b7r](http://imgur.com/a/B5b7r)

Here we go. A full album behind the link and the weight is 1.295t ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

This is probably pretty close to what can be done with something that still could be considered a spaceplane... Since you need some wing for it to be a plane (duh) and you need landing gear to be able to lift off like a plane instead of just vertical takeoff...

The easiest way to land this by far is just gliding of most of the speed with engine facing forward and then just doing a powered landing. Altough it is also capable of landing by gliding only (again engine facing forward) and then just using the engine for the final stop (~30m/s) since our only wheel doesn't have any breaks... but that can be quite hard to achieve.
